New Records: Ivan Schranz scored Slovakia's quickest goal at a major tournament
Key Match Events: Lukaku had two goals ruled out by VAR, one for offside and the second a handball
Belgium goalkeeper Koen Casteels made a superb diving save from Lukás Haraslín's excellent volley
Slovakia defender Dávid Hancko cleared the ball off the line after a goalmouth scramble
Pre-Game Insights: There had been talk before the game of this being a new Belgium, casting off the Golden Generation tag and filled with young talent, but the same problems persist.

Belgium players were without their preferred central defensive pairing of Jan Vertonghen and Arthur Theate, and with left-winger Jérémy Doku playing on the right in the first half and Yannick Carrasco as a left-wing back, there was a lack of balance to the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium coach Domenico Tedesco said that the missed chances were a shame but that there was no need to panic for his Belgian side.
Tedesco's side dominated the 90 minutes but lacked a clinical touch, and when they did find it they were denied by the VAR and the scrambling Slovakia defence.
Slovakia coach Francesco Calzona said that the lesser teams have made progress and can cause problems for the more prestigious nations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Slovakia joined Romania at the top of the standings after the latter's 3-0 win over Ukraine in Munich earlier on Monday.
Belgium next meet Romania in Cologne on Saturday.
